meanings.definition: The quality of being eager to know or learn something.
meanings.sent1: Her curiousness about the world led her to explore new places and cultures.
meanings.sent2: His curiousness about the stars made him want to become an astronaut.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiousness about the new toy made it play with it for hours.
meanings.sent4: The curiousness of the child was like a flame, always seeking new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The curiousness of the detective helped solve the mysterious case.

meanings.definition: A strange or unusual object or fact.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed many curiousnesses from ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent2: She found a curiousness in the attic that no one had seen for years.
meanings.sent3: The curiousness in the science lab turned out to be a rare mineral.
meanings.sent4: The curiousness in the forest was a tree with rainbow-colored leaves.
meanings.sent5: The curiousness in the old book was a hidden map to a treasure.
